name: Goodwill Industries of Denver - Dell Reconnect Donation Site
Central Facilities Center
hours: Monday: 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM Tuesday: 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM Wednesday: 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM Thursday: 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM Friday: 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM
materials: Aluminum Cans; Brown Paper Bags; Glass (Brown); Glass (Clear); Glass (Green); Magazines; Milk Cartons; Newspapers; Office Paper; Paper (Mixed); Paperboard; Phone books; Plastic #1 (PETE); Plastic #2 (HDPE); Plastic #3 (PVC); Plastic #4 (LDPE); Plastic #5 (Polypropylene); Plastic #7; Tin or Steel Cans; Corrugated Plastic Yard Signs
notes: Aurora's two city-owned recycling drop-off sites now require separation, which results in a product that is less contaminated by other materials than what results from single-stream recycling. Paper and magazines go into one bin, glass and plastics (numbered 1 through 7) go into another, and steel, aluminum, copper, brass and other metals may be placed in a 250-gallon tub on site. Political yard signs also are accepted; just place the signs in the plastics bin, and the metal frames in the scrap metal tub.
